title: The Fairlight Cycles Faran 3.0
content:
The Fairlight Cycles Faran is a crowd favorite with its cargo capacity and all-steel chassis. The UK brand just announced the latest version, 3.0 with a few updates. Let’s check it out…

The Faran chassis has undergone a series of refinements for version 3. Find them in a list below:

A Reynolds 725 front triangle with custom butting profiles. Reynolds 725 DZB downtube and a new 28.6mm top tube, ovalized to 25 × 32mm, for increased stability when carrying a front load.

The Faran 3.0 gets the same rear triangle as the Secan 3.0. Heavily curved and flattened stays to maximize compliance. Unique to Fairlight.

Increased tire clearance. Now compatible with up to 700 x 53mm and up to 62mm in 650B/27.5”.

Fairlight x Bentley Mk3 dropouts featuring a removable cable stop. Direct mount, standard hanger, and T-Type inserts. The disc side insert is now 160/180mm.

New Faran 3.0 fork. 160/180mm brake mount. We re-analyzed all the boss and braze-on locations and re-positioned them to offer a better fit with a wider variety of racks and cages. New mudguard/fender plate integrated into the base of the crown.

The downtube brake hose clips are now CNC-machined modular parts.

Dropper post compatible with 1x set-ups. We do a double-hose version of our new CNC downtube clips. There is a dropper exit port on the back of the seat tube.

3D-printed bottom bracket cable guide for mechanical gear set-ups. We have made one part do several jobs; as well as guiding the front and rear derailleur cables, it also acts as a guide for the brake hose, dropper post hose, and the dynamo rear light wire. Ultra utility – everything in its place.

Geometry – Small refinements. The chain stay length has increased by 2mm (430mm to 432mm) to add space for the larger 700c tyres. Head angle and fork offset have NOT changed – keeps the same mid-low trail geometry as the Mk2.0/2.5. Small adjustments to the stack and reach.

The all-new Fairlight Faran 3.0 frames arrive soon, but the pre-order page is live now at FairlightCycles.com. Check out the updated features at Fairlight. You’ll have to wait to see the new decals, but the paint colour options are Moss, Black (black on black like the stealth Strata 4.0, but with silver accents), and Burnt Orange.
